COLLECTION PROTOCOL ID (Required): A unique ID for the protocol.
COLLECTION PROTOCOL NAME: A short name for the protocol.
COLLECTION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: A general description of the protocol.
PUBLICATION DOI: The publication digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
PROTOCOLS.IO DOI: The protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
DOCUMENT FILENAME: A filename of a PDF document containing the details of the protocol.
COLLECTION METHOD (Required): A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term.
COLLECTION METHOD ONTOLOGY ID: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.
COLLECTION METHOD ONTOLOGY LABEL ONTOLOG: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.
RETAIL NAME: The retail name of the kit/reagent.
CATALOG NUMBER: The catalog number of the kit/reagent.
BATCH/LOT NUMBER: The batch or lot number of the kit/reagent.
EXPIRY DATE: The date of expiration for the kit/reagent.
TITER: Appropriate titer and volume recommendations found in kit/reagent Certificate of Analysis.

COLLECTION PROTOCOL ID (Required): Protocol ID should have no spaces.
COLLECTION METHOD (Required): For example: enzymatic dissociation; blood draw
COLLECTION METHOD ONTOLOGY LABEL ONTOLOG: For example: enzymatic dissociation; blood draw
RETAIL NAME: For example: SureCell WTA 3' Library Prep Kit; CytoTune iPS 2.0 Sendai Reprogramming Kit
EXPIRY DATE: Enter the date in date format: yyyy-mm-dd. Supplying partial date is allowed. For example: 2018-01-31; 2018-01

COLLECTION PROTOCOL ID (Required): FILL OUT INFORMATION BELOW THIS ROW

COLLECTION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: Lungs were flushed with cold complete medium (RPMI 1640, 10% FBS, 100 U/ml penicillin, 100 mg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine) and left lateral basal segment of the lung was isolated. After dissociation and enrichment, 0.5 – 1x106 CD3+ enriched cells were cultured in complete medium for 16 hours at 37°C. After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).

Lungs were flushed with cold complete medium (RPMI 1640, 10% FBS, 100 U/ml penicillin, 100 mg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine) and left lateral basal segment of the lung was isolated. After dissociation and enrichment, 0.5 – 1x106 CD3+ enriched cells were cultured in complete medium for 16 hours at 37°C with TCR stimulation using Human CD3/CD28 T Cell Activator (STEMCELL Technologies 10991). After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).
RETAIL NAME: Dead Cell Removal Kit; Human CD3/CD28 T Cell Activator

COLLECTION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: Lymph nodes were isolated from the hilum, near the intersections of major bronchi and pulmonary veins and arteries, removing all fat. After dissociation and enrichment, 0.5 – 1x106 CD3+ enriched cells were cultured in complete medium (RPMI 1640, 10% FBS, 100 U/ml penicillin, 100 mg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine) for 16 hours at 37°C. After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).

After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).
RETAIL NAME: Dead Cell Removal Kit; Human CD3/CD28 T Cell Activator

COLLECTION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: BM was aspirated from the superior iliac crest. After dissociation and enrichment, 0.5 – 1x106 CD3+ enriched cells were cultured in complete medium (RPMI 1640, 10% FBS, 100 U/ml penicillin, 100 mg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine) for 16 hours at 37°C. After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).

COLLECTION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: We obtained peripheral blood from healthy consenting adult volunteers by venipuncture, through a protocol approved by the Columbia University IRB. After dissociation and enrichment, 0.5 – 1x106 CD3+ enriched cells were cultured in complete medium (RPMI 1640, 10% FBS, 100 U/ml penicillin, 100 mg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine) for 16 hours at 37°C. After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).

We obtained peripheral blood from healthy consenting adult volunteers by venipuncture, through a protocol approved by the Columbia University IRB. BM was aspirated from the superior iliac crest. After dissociation and enrichment, 0.5 – 1x106 CD3+ enriched cells were cultured in complete medium (RPMI 1640, 10% FBS, 100 U/ml penicillin, 100 mg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine) for 16 hours at 37°C with TCR stimulation using Human CD3/CD28 T Cell Activator (STEMCELL Technologies 10991). After 16 hours, dead cells were removed with a dead cell removal kit (Miltenyi 130-090-101).
RETAIL NAME: Dead Cell Removal Kit; Human CD3/CD28 T Cell Activator
